revised_title: Singular Conversion of a Bird's Substance into Hard Fatty Matter
tldr: Thomas Sneyd discovered a bird's substance that had been converted into a hard fatty matter, resembling spermaceti, near a fish pool. The substance had no taste or smell, melted at low heat, and burned at a higher temperature. Sneyd speculated that the bird underwent this change while buried in the mud and was washed up by a nearby brook. The case bears a resemblance to the transformation of human bodies observed by M. Foucault in the Cemetery des Innocents.
